column5: Thanks Bill.Plates always look good with fresh fish on it.Even though i would get tired of shorelunches throughout the season iam really missing the big big shorelunches we would do on Eagle Lake with big parties and 2-3 other guides.Some would have 25+ people on shore someplace.Always so much fun.
Hey John, how is the water level on Cedar and Perrault Lake? Thx!
Look√®d to be up a ft from last week.pretty close to normal

Did a solo trip to Cedar yesterday.Was a cool start at 3c.Crazy weather here so far.Water temps back down to 56 F. Thought it would be tough fishing after the last 4 days of rain,cold temps with tornado warnings but fishing was really good. I stopped in a nice little cove out of the wind and in the sun and caught fish instantly in a couple of ft of water.Stayed real close to Clarks camp and wster is reslly clear there where i could see fish swimming around.Nice to see that.One other spot i tried had fish on 2 diff humps at 9-11 ft coming out of 20 ft so no real pattern.Dont think i burnt a 1/2 gallon of gas yesterday.
Nice pics john,clear skies cool weather n a little chop on the water,And a nice eater in one pic,Perfect
Thx Ron.Was nice to get.4 days at home in the rain got old.lol.

Ron the fish in pics went back.We like the smaller fish.Just wife and i.Dont need much for a meal.Brought home a few good sized perch to.Couple of worms but they come out easy.Buddy of mine makes a fish batter he sells around here and its really good to.Not a shorelunch but did fry them outside.
Hope to be there 3rd week of july. Hopefully clarks will be fully open by then. Coming from manitoba.
Clarks are always ready.lol.will be nice to see another on the lake.been quite.
Now that's a meal to be proud of,dam that looks good
x2, just ate and looking it this made me hungry all over again! Very nice pictures also!!
Feel very lucky living north of the border and being able to use our awesome resources.
All alluring pictures, plate pic looks to be of recipe art quality - John you may have a whole new career just around the corner, waiting for you to be titled as "Guide Chef" Bill
